title.narrative: Somalia Somaliland Puntland Joint Response II

description.narrative: Pastoralist communities in southern Woqooyi Galbeed (WG) Province

The ZOA intervention under this programme focuses on the sectors Food Security and Livelihoods (FSL) and Water, Sanitation, Hygiene (WaSH) through focusing on the following results: FSL.R2. Enable 'emergency', 'crisis', and stressed population groups to produce and exchange food to sustain their livelihoods (SO1, SO2, SO3) / FSL.R3. Restore and build household and community productive assets and capacities (including through C4W) (SO3) / W.R1. Improved access to safe water, sanitation, and hygiene for people in emergency need (SO1)

This activity covers the ZOA implementation under the Somaliland/Puntland Joint Response II, which is a programme funded by the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs through the Dutch Relief Alliance (DRA), a cooperation of Dutch international organizations. This activity is funded through Care Netherlands, lead agency for this Joint Response. Strategic Objectives for this Joint Response are: SO1: Improved household access to food for the most vulnerable (contributes to SO1)SO2: Enable 'emergency', 'crisis', and stressed population groups to produce and exchange food to sustain their livelihoods (also contributes to SO1, SO3)SO3: Restore and build household and community productive assets and capacities (including through C4W)

title.narrative: FSL.R1: Improved household access to food for the most vulnerable (SO1)
# of individuals benefiting from unconditional cash transfers

comment.narrative: At the end of the project in August 2017, we received extra funds from the alliance lead agency CARE and transfered unconditional cash to 75 IDP households.

title.narrative: FSL.R2: Enable 'emergency', 'crisis', and stressed population groups to produce and exchange food to sustain their livelihoods (SO1, SO2, SO3)

description.narrative: Provide vaccination and veterinary medicines for small ruminents

location.ref: Salahley, Bali gubadle, Sabawanag, Galoole, Raybadka, Ina Higire, Qoolbulale, Lebisagaala, Gumar, Balimataan, Gaas

comment.narrative: 64,786 animals were treated in 55 communities across three districts (not just the 8 project villages), benefitiing an estimated 1,920 HH. The revised target was a change to the original plan in order to coordinate with the Ministry of Livestock and sector partners in a joint response of all stakeholders country wide.

title.narrative: W.R1: Improved access to safe water, sanitation, and hygiene for people in emergency need (SO1)

location.ref: Salahley, Bali gubadle, Sabawanag, Galoole, Raybadka, Ina Higire, Qoolbulale, Lebisagaala, Gumar, Balimataan, Gaas

comment.narrative: 8 water management committees were trained to serve 8 communities. A total of 65 individuals were trained to monitor the distribution of water and water filters. They were also trained to delivery WASH messages to accompany the distribution of water filters.

title.narrative: #Individuals benefitting from WMC activities and messages on hygiene

description.narrative: Disseminate messages on good hygiene practices, focusing on key messages for disease control, and targeted to differentiated needs of women and men

location.ref: Salahley, Bali gubadle, Sabawanag, Galoole, Raybadka, Ina Higire, Qoolbulale, Lebisagaala, Gumar, Balimataan, Gaas

comment.narrative: The hygiene campaign was held for the whole community and not only for those that received water filters. 3,168HH were visited by hygiene promoters across 8 communities.

description.narrative: Distribute household water filters with household water storage capacity and attending sensitisation on household hygiene and proper use of filters, etc.

comment.narrative: 1,259 HH benefitted from distribution of ceramic pot water filters across 8 communities. Ceramic pot filter is an inexpensive and effective type of water filter that rely on small pore size of ceramic material to filter dirt and bacteria out of water. The filters were purchased from the Somaliland Red Crescent who produce the filters locally in partnership with German Red Cross.

location.ref: Salahley, Bali gubadle, Sabawanag, Raybadka, Ina Higire, Qoolbulale, Leebisagaala, Gumar, Balimataan, Gaas

comment.narrative: Under the CFW component seven balis (ponds) were desilted to rehabilitate large scale community water catchment resevoirs.

title.narrative: #Individuals benefitting from direct provision of water (vouchers, trucking)

description.narrative: Provision of water vouchers, water trucking, and distribution of household water treatment products

location.ref: Salahley, Bali gubadle, Sabawanag, Galoole, Raybadka, Ina Higire, Qoolbulale, Lebisagaala, Gumar, Balimataan, Gaas

comment.narrative: 1,259 HH benificiaries from direct provision of water across 8 communities An additional 75 households in the Balimataan IDP camp were assisted with water deliveries with the supplemental grant at the end of the project.

title.narrative: FSL.R3: Restore and build household and community productive assets and capacities (including through C4W) (SO3)
# Individuals benefitting from improved community assets

description.narrative: Restore and/or build community productive assets through C4W or other incentives

location.ref: Salahley, Bali gubadle, Sabawanag, Galoole, Raybadka, Ina Higire, Qoolbulale, Lebisagaala, Gumar, Balimataan, Gaas

comment.narrative: 650 HH participated in the cash transfers by doing CFW activities like desilting of ponds, soil bunds, water monitors and hygiene promoters across 8 communities. Pond desilting was particularly significant in the sense that it contributed to increased harvest in rain water
